meanings.sent1: I had to hagg the thick branches to clear the path.
meanings.sent2: The lumberjack used an axe to hagg the tree into firewood.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to hagg the vegetables with enthusiasm, creating a messy but tasty dish.
meanings.sent4: She hagg-ed away at the block of wood, shaping it into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the axe as it began to hagg echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: A pile of brushwood or undergrowth.
meanings.sent1: The hagg of twigs and leaves made a cozy nest for the rabbit.
meanings.sent2: We gathered a large hagg of branches for the bonfire.
meanings.sent3: The children used the hagg as a secret hiding spot during their game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The hagg of dried leaves rustled in the wind, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The hagg of sticks near the campfire provided fuel for the night.
